datafield.subfield: sponsored by the American Folklife Center and the National Council for the Traditional Arts.
16 sound tape reels: analog, 7 1/2 ips, 2 track, mono., 10 in.

Documentation of the monthly 1977 Neptune Concert Series, which consists of manuscript materials, sound recordings, and photographs of performers of bluegrass music, country music, blues music, Andean music, Cajun music, and Missouri fiddling recorded live outdoors on Neptune Plaza in front of the Thomas Jefferson Building, Library of Congress, from April through October 1977, sponsored by the American Folklife Center and the National Council for the Traditional Arts.
Hobbs Sisters and Bob Goff (Musical group)
Archive of Folk Culture (Library of Congress),
National Council for the Traditional Arts,

did.abstract: Documentation of the monthly 1977 Neptune Concert Series, which consists of manuscript materials, sound recordings, and photographs of performers of bluegrass music, country music, blues music, Andean music, Cajun music, and Missouri fiddling recorded live outdoors on Neptune Plaza in front of the Thomas Jefferson Building, Library of Congress, from April through October 1977, sponsored by the American Folklife Center and the National Council for the Traditional Arts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The 1977 Neptune Plaza Concert Series Collection consists of manuscript and print materials, audio recordings, and graphic materials that document the 1977 concert series sponsored by the American Folklife Center. The annual series, which began in 1977, features the presentation of folk traditions from many cultures. The concerts took place on the Neptune Plaza at the front of the Jefferson Building of the Library of Congress between April and October. Adverse weather conditions sometimes forced the concerts indoors. The 1977 series was produced with the assistance of the National Council for the Traditional Arts.

The 1977 season consisted of the following:
Date Performers Place of Origin Subject
April 25 Bluegrass Cardinals Virginia Bluegrass music
May 23 John Jackson Virginia Blues music
June 8 Southern Mountain Boys Delaware Bluegrass music
June 29 Los Rumi Songos Washington, D.C. Andean music
July 27 The Balfa Brothers Louisiana Cajun music
July 27 Joe Politte Missouri French style fiddling
September 14 Bob Goff, Jr. and the Hobbs Sisters Virginia Bluegrass music
October 19 Ola Belle Reed Maryland Country music

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: Documentation created and accessioned by the American Folklife Center in 1977.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and listed alphabetically therein.

controlaccess.head: Organizations
controlaccess.corpname: Archive of Folk Culture (Library of Congress), collector.
Hobbs Sisters and Bob Goff (Musical group) performer.
National Council for the Traditional Arts, sponsor.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Listening and viewing access to the collection is unrestricted. Duplication of the collection materials may be governed by copyright and other restrictions.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 1977 Neptune Plaza Concert Series Collection (AFC 1977/003), Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
